project.name: Gentoo PPC
project.description: The PowerPC Development Project is devoted to keeping Gentoo in good shape on the PowerPC architecture.

longdescription.p: The Gentoo/PPC Project works to keep Gentoo the most up to date and fastest PowerPC distribution available. We are responsible for the maintainance of all powerpc specific meta-data and the testing of all other non powerpc specific meta-data on the PowerPC architecture to ensure portability. Portability implies reuseable meta-data.

Bugs are tracked and resolved from the Gentoo bug tracker (for only ppc related bugs check this link) and correspondence is maintained on the various PowerPC related mailinglists. (gentoo-ppc-user, gentoo-ppc-dev and those belonging to the sub-projects).

goals.p: The goal of the Gentoo PowerPC development project is to guarantee that the PowerPC packages build using Gentoo meta-data are up to date. By continuously enhancing the meta-data, we provide the PowerPC user with the Gentoo community feeling, performance, freedom and up to dateness. The meta-distribution notion allows for a user to to be as bleeding edge as he/she wants:

Gentoo is unique because of its interpretation of the Meta-Distribution notion: all architectures share the same 'generic' meta-data (information about how to build packages - how to build a distribution). The PowerPC developers are responsible for building and testing packages using this meta-data. The meta-data gets marked 'tested' or 'stable' afterwards, depending on the building and testing expierience. Our users can use (but don't have to use) this information to build a system that suits their needs.

extraproject.name: LiveCD/DVD
extraproject.p: The development and maintenance of LiveCD related tools. A livecd is a bootable wrapper around a live gentoo environment. A live gentoo environment is applied meta-data. This project gives people an opportunity to build and create their own bootable Gentoo LiveCD or LiveDVD. A liveCD/DVD primary purpose is to showcase what a concrete realisation of the meta-data will look like. Often Specialized livecds are build; automated distributed cross compile no livecds, Livecds that allow people working on PowerPC hardware development to write and test drivers without having to install...
The livecd project works closely together with other architectures, developing a generic multi-architecture and multi-platform liveCD/DVD building tool.

extraproject.name: Stages
extraproject.p: The development and maintenance of 'stage' tarballs. A stage tarball is a live environment, packed and compressed into a UNIX tarball. A live environment is applied meta-data. (some packages forming a concrete Gentoo system).
The Stages project works closely together with other architectures, developing a generic multi-architecture and multi-platform live environment building tool.

This project has a GLEP pending:
Portage enhancement: allow users to create their own virtual stage (for instance a desktop stage or a server stage ... ). This functionality will be demo-ed in the portage-ng prototype core.

extraproject.name: Kernels
extraproject.p: Responsible for creating and maintaining PowerPC kernels. This includes creating and maintaining the kernel configuration for use on the LiveCD/DVDs.

body.p: Since 2004-07-22 Pylon has been taking over Pieters Strategical Lead. In fact it was with great pleasure that Pieter proposed Pylon as "The man for the job" in our meeting. We thank Pieter or his support, motivation and continuous effort for PPC. We wish to thank Pylon for taking on the effort and are happy to know PPC is in good hands.

The ppc64 efforts and development is brought to you by tgall you can check his site for changes and informations. He is also helping other subprojects with his expertise on powerpc and specific hardware.

The ppc-team has changed some roles and assigned new persons to the subproject. First of all we wish to thank the developers who have helped us so far. They have done an excellent job and have made ppc as it is now.
We wish to thank dostrow for taking the stable project under his wings. He has recently become a developer but has already served ppc with great motivation and effort.
dholm will be leading the kernel branch and johnm, lu_zero and sejo will be helping him. We all know that dholm is a great teamplayer and we are proud that he wishes to take the lead on this subproject.
This website will be taken care of by sejo, and he'll be taking on the documentation subproject. Bear with him as he might overlook some spelling errors :-). Currently we would like to ask any of you who are interested in working with this team to step forward in the irc channel and ask one of us to help out. We are still looking for some hard workers to join our team.

The ppc-team voted for Luca Barbato (lu_zero) as the operational manager. He takes care and makes decisions on the daily work on Gentoo/PPC. He will also keep helping the kernel team and other subprojects where he can. Usually you can find him in the channel #gentoo-ppc in the freenode-IRC-Net.

Can you make computers do amazing things? Are you excited about exploring areas of computing never explored before? We are continuously looking for volunteers willing to spend some of their free time on this project. In return for your work, you get the respect of the PPC community.

If you are interested in helping, but don't have a niche that you are interested in filling, you can always look through bugs.gentoo.org. There are many many bugs waiting to be found and fixed and many enhancements looking to find someone to code them. Figure out a fix, implement it, test it, and then keep trying to make the patch smaller. Post it for review on bugs.gentoo.org, and keep working on it. If it seems ignored, make a new comment in the bug and/or mention it in #gentoo-ppc in the freenode-IRC-Net.
for more information on how the PPC team recruits please read this doc.
